author: Holly
text:
Filters are inaccurate, placed filter for womens sz 9 for Valentino sneakers. Bought a pair, got them and they were way too big… so quickly ordered other shoes in sz 8 instead and started the process of retuning the others- as I’m leaving out of town on a trip I wanted to bring those to. 

I’m being charged for the return and when I printed out the label— the description is menswear! This was not on any of the other order forms prior to buying. 

I had someone check my new order, I have a mix of both mens and womens Valentino sneakers sz 8- going down a size as I was trying to get a pair of womens shoes to fit me. Well basically I’m being charged again for all the shipping, returns, etc for shoes which are going to be BOTH too big (mens) and too small (womens). 

I’m fine with weary man’s shoe if they accurately filtered; for example if you want a womens 9, you could get BOTH mens 7 AND womens 9.

author: Jennifer A.
text:
Still not sure how I feel about luxury resale and here it why. Obviously, it was my choice to look for a used/worn but good version of the LongChamp Le Pliage tote. I was on the market for a budget-friendly purchase from a trusted source. I've seen mixed reviews about The Real Real and wanted to give it a try myself. I should have known better.

I found a tote within my budget and appeared to be well taken care of for a used tote bag. It was everything I had wanted for the price tag. I felt a bit disappointed after completing my order because I realized the total cost would bring me close to a brand new tote. But again, I decided to follow through.

When my tote arrived, it was well packaged and in a dust bag. The bag appeared as the photos except for trash inside the bag. There was a tattered gum packet inside the bag and let's just face it, I was disgusted. Where is quality assurance? It made me check other reviews of mishaps and also made me question whether or not it's an authentic bag.

Needless to say, I don't think I would purchase again. I don't want a hit and miss product. I feel that there still needs to be improvements in order for me to ever decide to make another purchase.
title: Still not sure how I feel about luxury…

author: Samantha
text: Absolutely ridiculous. My package came vandalized and damaged and all customer service is saying is that they will give me a 25 dollar refund, that there is nothing else they can do. All shipments are insured, there is plenty they can do, they just don’t want to. How on earth can a company operate this way. It’s almost fraudulent. This was my first time buying from them and I will not be shipping with them ever again. I will never recommend them to anyone I know either. What a completely unreliable company. Their claim that they provide a safe and reliable platform for buyers and sellers of luxury items is absolute hogwash.
title: Absolutely ridiculous

author: Aaron
text:
It is the very first time I shop at the RealReal. First of all, I was unable to use the $25 coupon I had received via email. I kept getting a message that made no sense.
So I decided to shop without it as I had already chosen some items. 
The box with the items arrived within a reasonable period of time, however it was packed somewhat carelessly. Out of 4 items I wanted to return one that did not fit. Again, it is my first time shopping here so maybe I am the one who is missing information.  The skirt that I want to return is too small on me, plus one of the belt loops is loose, needs to be sawn in place. That's how I received it. I tried looking and looking for a phone number to call customer service and I found none.... FRUSTRATING...
Not the best first experience :(

author: customer
text: I filtered clothes for my size, XS, and the brand I was looking for, Patagonia. The pants I purchased were listed in my XS search but they are not true XS Patagonia pants. Patagonia uses the number system for sizing on some items and the letter system for sizing on others. I should have read the description more closely because it did say XS/2, but you should list items based on what is actually on the tag to be consistent with how manufacturers label their clothing. I would have never purchased size 2 Patagonia pants because I know they don’t fit me. But I trusted what was listed in my search for XS bottoms. The pants were also listed as “very good” condition. The butt has a number of pulls and missing thread around the pockets. Disappointed with my experience, as I now have pants that are to big and not returnable. Will still with my local consignment shop, thread up and Patagonia’s used online site.
title: I filtered clothes for my size
